newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo prosecutors arrest copper trader Hamanaka - TV.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo prosecutors arrest copper trader Hamanaka - TV.

text.p: Tokyo prosecutors arrested Sumitomo Corp's former chief copper trader Yasuo Hamanaka for suspected forgery, Japanese public television station NHK said on Tuesday.
A Sumitomo spokesman said earlier a top executive would hold a news conference at 2.30 p.m. (0530 GMT) on Tuesday regarding legal action against Hamanaka.

On September 19, Sumitomo announced it was preparing for legal action against Hamanaka, who it blamed for $2.6 billion in losses from unauthorised copper trading. Sumitomo fired Hamanaka in mid-June when it announced the losses.
